ingredients: [{"ingredients":"200g butter , softened, plus extra for the tin"},{"ingredients":"2 large ripe bananas (250g peeled weight)"},{"ingredients":"250g light brown soft sugar"},{"ingredients":"4 large eggs"},{"ingredients":"1½ tsp vanilla extract"},{"ingredients":"250g self-raising flour"},{"ingredients":"100g natural yogurt"},{"ingredients":"100g dark chocolate , chopped into chunks"},{"ingredients":"100g thick caramel or dulce de leche (we used a can of Carnation caramel)"},{"ingredients":"12 dried banana chips , to serve (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Butter and line a 20 x 30cm baking tin with two strips of criss-crossed baking parchment. In a jug, mash the bananas with a fork, then add the butter and sugar and mix with an electric whisk until smooth and creamy."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition, then add the vanilla and a pinch of salt. Use a spatula to fold through the flour, yogurt and chocolate chunks. Scrape the mixture into the tin and smooth over the surface. Bake for 30 mins until risen and golden and a skewer inserted into the centre of the cake comes out clean. Cool for 10 mins in the tin, then transfer to a wire rack."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Cut the traybake into 12 squares, then top each one with a spoonful of caramel and a banana chip, if you like. Will keep in a tin for up to five days, or in the freezer – without the toppings – for up to a month."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"225g digestive biscuits"},{"ingredients":"100g butter, melted"},{"ingredients":"250g tub  mascarpone"},{"ingredients":"600g soft cheese"},{"ingredients":"2 eggs, plus 2 yolks"},{"ingredients":"zest 3 lemons, juice of 1"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp  plain flour"},{"ingredients":"175g caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"½ a 284ml pot soured cream"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp lemon curd"},{"ingredients":"handful  raspberries, to serve (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 180C/fan 160C/gas 4. Line the bottom of a 23cm springform tin with greaseproof paper. Tip the biscuits and melted butter into a food processor, then blitz to make fine crumbs. Press into the tin and chill."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Whisk all the other ingredients in a large bowl until completely combined, pour into the tin, then bake for 35-40 mins until the cheesecake has a uniform wobble."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Turn off the oven and leave the cake inside until cool. When it is completely cooled, remove from the tin and top with soured cream. Swirl lemon curd over the top and decorate with raspberries, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"150g unsalted butter , plus extra for the ramekins"},{"ingredients":"200g dark chocolate (70% cocoa), roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"90g golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"3 large eggs"},{"ingredients":"90ml Guinness or other stout"},{"ingredients":"clotted cream or thick double cream, to serve (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Butter four 9 x 5cm ramekins and set aside. Tip the butter, chocolate and a generous pinch of salt into a heatproof bowl. Set over a small pan of just-simmering water and stir until melted, then remove from the heat and leave to cool a little."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Put the sugar and eggs in a large mixing bowl and beat with an electric whisk until pale, almost doubled in volume and thick enough to leave a trail when the beaters are lifted up. Gently fold in the melted chocolate and the Guinness. Spoon the mixture into the ramekins, then chill in the fridge for 1 hr. Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6 and put a baking tray on the top shelf to heat up."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Place the ramekins on the hot baking tray and bake for 18 mins. Remove from the oven and leave to stand for a minute, then serve with a dollop of cream, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"250g plain white flour"},{"ingredients":"250g plain wholemeal flour"},{"ingredients":"100g porridge oats"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp bicarbonate of soda"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp salt"},{"ingredients":"25g butter, cut in pieces"},{"ingredients":"500ml buttermilk"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Preheat the oven to 200C/gas 6/fan 180C and dust a baking sheet with flour. Mix the dry ingredients in a large bowl, then rub in the butter. Pour in the buttermilk and mix it in quickly with a table knife, then bring the dough together very lightly with your fingertips (handle it very, very gently). Now shape it into a flat, round loaf measuring 20cm/8in in diameter."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Put the loaf on the baking sheet and score a deep cross in the top. (Traditionally, this lets the fairies out, but it also helps the bread to cook through.) Bake for 30-35 minutes until the bottom of the loaf sounds hollow when tapped. If it isn’t ready after this time, turn it upside down on the baking sheet and bake for a few minutes more."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Transfer to a wire rack, cover with a clean tea towel (this keeps the crust nice and soft) and leave to cool. To serve, break into quarters, then break or cut each quarter in half to make 8 wedges or slices – or simply slice across. Eat very fresh."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"150g salted butter, softened"},{"ingredients":"80g light brown muscovado sugar"},{"ingredients":"80g granulated sugar"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp vanilla extract"},{"ingredients":"1 large egg"},{"ingredients":"225g plain flour"},{"ingredients":"½ tsp bicarbonate of soda"},{"ingredients":"¼ tsp salt"},{"ingredients":"200g plain chocolate chips or chunks"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oven to 190C/fan170C/gas 5 and line two baking sheets with non-stick baking paper."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Put 150g softened salted butter, 80g light brown muscovado sugar and 80g granulated sugar into a bowl and beat until creamy."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Beat in 2 tsp vanilla extract and 1 large egg."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Sift 225g plain flour, ½ tsp bicarbonate of soda and ¼ tsp salt into the bowl and mix it in with a wooden spoon."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"Add 200g plain chocolate chips or chunks and stir well."},{"method":"STEP 6"},{"method":"Use a teaspoon to make small scoops of the mixture, spacing them well apart on the baking trays. This mixture should make about 30 cookies."},{"method":"STEP 7"},{"method":"Bake for 8–10 mins until they are light brown on the edges and still slightly soft in the centre if you press them."},{"method":"STEP 8"},{"method":"Leave on the tray for a couple of mins to set and then lift onto a cooling rack."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"200g unsalted butter, plus a little extra for greasing"},{"ingredients":"100g chocolate, 70% cocoa solids"},{"ingredients":"100g chocolate, 50% cocoa solids"},{"ingredients":"397g can Carnation caramel"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp flaky sea salt, plus a little extra for the top"},{"ingredients":"200g golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"4 medium eggs, at room temperature"},{"ingredients":"130g plain flour"},{"ingredients":"50g cocoa powder"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Grease then line a 23cm square traybake tin with baking parchment."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Melt 200g unsalted butter in a medium pan, break in 100g chocolate (70% cocoa solids) and 100g chocolate (50% cocoa solids), then remove the pan from the heat and wait for the cubes to melt."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"In a small bowl, mix 175g Carnation caramel from a 397g can with 1 tsp sea salt – it will loosen up."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"Put the rest of the caramel in a large bowl with 200g golden caster sugar and 4 medium eggs, and beat with an electric hand mixer or balloon whisk until even. Whisk in the chocolate and butter."},{"method":"STEP 6"},{"method":"In another bowl, combine 130g plain flour, 50g cocoa powder and a good pinch of table salt, then sift this on top of the chocolate mix. Beat briefly until smooth."},{"method":"STEP 7"},{"method":"Pour half the brownie batter into the tin and level it with a spatula."},{"method":"STEP 8"},{"method":"Using a teaspoon, spoon half of the salted caramel on top of the batter layer in 5 thick, evenly spaced stripes."},{"method":"STEP 9"},{"method":"Spoon the rest of the brownie batter on top and smooth it out, trying not to disturb the caramel beneath. Top with the rest of the caramel in the same stripy fashion. Drag a skewer or tip of a knife through the caramel to make a feathered pattern on the top."},{"method":"STEP 10"},{"method":"Scatter with a little more sea salt, then bake for 25-30 mins or until risen all the way to the middle with a firm crust on top. When ready, the brownie will jiggle just a little when you shake the tin."},{"method":"STEP 11"},{"method":"Let it cool completely in the tin, then cut into squares."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"140g golden caster sugar , plus 200g extra for dusting"},{"ingredients":"200g plain flour"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp bicarbonate of soda"},{"ingredients":"100ml natural yogurt"},{"ingredients":"2 large eggs , beaten"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp vanilla extract"},{"ingredients":"140g butter , melted, plus extra for greasing"},{"ingredients":"12 tsp seedless raspberry jam"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 190C/170C fan/gas 5. Lightly grease a 12-hole muffin tin (or use a silicone one). Put 140g sugar, flour and bicarb in a bowl and mix to combine. In a jug, whisk together the yogurt, eggs and vanilla. Tip the jug contents and melted butter into the dry ingredients and quickly fold with a metal spoon to combine."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Divide two-thirds of the mixture between the muffin holes. Carefully add 1 tsp jam into the centre of each, then cover with the remaining mixture. Bake for 16-18 mins until risen, golden and springy to touch."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Leave the muffins to cool for 5 mins before lifting out of the tin and rolling in the extra sugar."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"200g caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"200g softened butter"},{"ingredients":"4 eggs, beaten"},{"ingredients":"200g self-raising flour"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp  baking powder"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp milk"},{"ingredients":"100g butter, softened"},{"ingredients":"140g icing sugar, sifted"},{"ingredients":"drop vanilla extract (optional)"},{"ingredients":"half a 340g jar good-quality strawberry jam"},{"ingredients":"icing sugar, to decorate"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 190C/fan 170C/gas 5. Butter two 20cm sandwich tins and line with non-stick baking paper."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"In a large bowl, beat 200g caster sugar, 200g softened butter, 4 beaten eggs, 200g self-raising flour, 1 tsp baking powder and 2 tbsp milk together until you have a smooth, soft batter."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Divide the mixture between the tins, smooth the surface with a spatula or the back of a spoon."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Bake for about 20 mins until golden and the cake springs back when pressed."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"Turn onto a cooling rack and leave to cool completely."},{"method":"STEP 6"},{"method":"To make the filling, beat the 100g softened butter until smooth and creamy, then gradually beat in 140g sifted icing sugar and a drop of vanilla extract (if you’re using it)."},{"method":"STEP 7"},{"method":"Spread the buttercream over the bottom of one of the sponges. Top it with 170g strawberry jam and sandwich the second sponge on top."},{"method":"STEP 8"},{"method":"Dust with a little icing sugar before serving. Keep in an airtight container and eat within 2 days."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"225ml sunflower oil , plus extra for the tins"},{"ingredients":"250g caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"3 large eggs"},{"ingredients":"225ml milk"},{"ingredients":"250g self-raising flour"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp cocoa"},{"ingredients":"1½ tsp bicarbonate of soda"},{"ingredients":"150g raspberry jam"},{"ingredients":"100g frozen raspberries , defrosted"},{"ingredients":"300ml double cream"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp icing sugar"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Oil and line two round 20cm springform cake tins with baking parchment. Whisk the oil, sugar, eggs and milk in a bowl until smooth. Sieve the flour, cocoa and bicarb into another large bowl, then gradually mix in the wet ingredients."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Divide the mixture between the tins and bake for 35-40 mins until the cakes are risen and spring back when pressed. Leave to cool in the tins for 10 mins, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"For the raspberry layer, stir the jam and the defrosted raspberries together. Once the cakes are cool, whip the cream with the sugar to soft peaks, then gently fold half the raspberry mixture through the cream to create a ripple effect."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Spoon most of the reserved raspberry mixture over one of the cakes, then dollop on half of the cream. Smooth over with a palette knife, then place the other sponge on top. Swirl over the remaining cream and swirl the last of the raspberry mixture through it. Will keep in the fridge for two days."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"125g plain flour"},{"ingredients":"25g cocoa powder"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp baking powder"},{"ingredients":"1 large egg"},{"ingredients":"60g caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp vegetable oil"},{"ingredients":"100ml whole milk"},{"ingredients":"50g chocolate chips (optional)"},{"ingredients":"100g icing sugar"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Line a muffin tin with six muffin cases. Sieve the flour, cocoa and baking powder into a medium bowl. Mix together the egg, sugar, oil and milk together in a jug, then gradually pour into the dry ingredients (add chocolate chips now to make double chocolate muffins, if you like) and mix until combined."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Spoon the mixture evenly into the cake cases and bake for 20-25 mins until a skewer inserted into the middle comes out clean. Remove from the oven and leave to cool."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Meanwhile, gradually mix ½-1 tbsp water into the icing sugar until you have a loose consistency that's not too runny. Drizzle the icing over the muffins once cool."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"225g baking spread"},{"ingredients":"225g self-raising flour"},{"ingredients":"1 level tsp baking powder"},{"ingredients":"100g golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"100g brown sugar"},{"ingredients":"4 large eggs"},{"ingredients":"finely grated zest of 2 oranges"},{"ingredients":"150g butter, softened"},{"ingredients":"300g icing sugar, sifted"},{"ingredients":"finely grated zest of 2 oranges"},{"ingredients":"25g caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"juice of 2 oranges"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. You will need 2 x 20cm loose-bottomed sandwich tins, greased and bases lined with baking parchment. Measure all the cake ingredients into a large bowl (reserve a little orange zest for decoration) and beat with a wooden spoon or electric hand mixer until combined and smooth."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Divide evenly between the 2 tins. Bake for 20-25 mins or until well risen, lightly golden and shrinking away from the sides of the tins. After 5 mins, remove from the tins and leave to cool on a wire rack."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"To make the icing, put the butter and icing sugar into a bowl and mix with an electric hand mixer until light and fluffy. Stir in the orange zest."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Remove the paper from the cakes. Sit 1 cake upside down on a plate. Make the glaze by putting the caster sugar and orange juice into a saucepan, stirring over a low heat until the sugar has dissolved. Boil until reduced by half, then brush half on the upside-down cake, using a pastry brush. Spread half the butter icing over the glazed cake. Sit the other cake on top, brush with the remaining glaze, then spread with the remaining butter icing. Scatter with the reserved orange zest. The cake is best eaten on the day, but will keep for up to 3 days in a cool place. It freezes well un-iced or filled."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"500g granary, strong wholewheat or white bread flour (I used granary)"},{"ingredients":"7g sachet fast-action dried yeast"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp salt"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp clear honey"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Tip the flour, yeast and salt into a large bowl and mix together with your hands. Stir 300ml hand-hot water with the oil and honey, then stir into the dry ingredients to make a soft dough."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 5 mins, until the dough no longer feels sticky, sprinkling with a little more flour if you need it."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Oil a 900g loaf tin and put the dough in the tin, pressing it in evenly. Put in a large plastic food bag and leave to rise for 1 hr, until the dough has risen to fill the tin and it no longer springs back when you press it with your finger."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/fan 180C/gas 6. Make several slashes across the top of the loaf with a sharp knife, then bake for 30-35 mins until the loaf is risen and golden. Tip it out onto a cooling rack and tap the base of the bread to check it is cooked. It should sound hollow. Leave to cool."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 cucumber"},{"ingredients":"zest and juice 1 lemon"},{"ingredients":"300g butter , softened, plus extra for greasing"},{"ingredients":"300g golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"4 large eggs"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp vanilla extract"},{"ingredients":"400g self raising flour"},{"ingredients":"1 ½ tsp baking powder"},{"ingredients":"200g butter , softened"},{"ingredients":"500g icing sugar"},{"ingredients":"80g strawberries , hulled"},{"ingredients":"200g butter , softened"},{"ingredients":"400g icing sugar"},{"ingredients":"juice & zest 1 lemon"},{"ingredients":"100g strawberries , hulled and sliced plus 3 strawberries, halved, (stalks on)"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp Pimm's"},{"ingredients":"¼ cucumber , sliced"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the sliced and halved strawberries for the filling and decoration into a small bowl and pour over the Pimm's. Leave to soak in for at least one hour or overnight. Heat oven to 190C /170C fan/gas 5. Line 3 x 20cm sandwich tins with baking parchment and grease with butter."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Cut the whole cucumber in half lengthways and using a teaspoon scrape out and discard the seeds. Roughly chop the rest of the cucumber and puree in a blender with the lemon juice."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"In a large bowl and using electric beaters whisk up the softened butter with the sugar until pale and light. Continue whisking as you add the eggs, one at a time, whisking in between additions. Once all the eggs have been added pour in the cucumber purée, lemon zest and vanilla extract. Don’t worry if the mixture splits - it will come back together when you add the flour."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Fold in the flour and baking powder and whisk once again briefly until there are no lumps of flour remaining then divide the mixture between the three tins. Bake in the oven for 30-35mins or until a skewer pushed into the middle of the cakes comes out clean. Take the cakes out of the oven and leave to cool in their tins for five minutes then turn out onto wire racks to cool completely."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"While the cakes are cooking and cooling make the buttercreams. To make the strawberry buttercream, mash the strawberries in a small bowl with a fork until mushy. In a larger bowl whisk up the butter and half the icing sugar until smooth, then whisk in the mashed strawberries followed by the remaining icing sugar. Whisk until smooth and pale pink and place in the fridge until needed. Repeat the process with the lemon buttercream."},{"method":"STEP 6"},{"method":"Once the cakes are completely cold, put one of the cakes onto a cake turntable and add about one third of the lemon buttercream, spread over the surface evenly then top with half of the soaked strawberry slices. Next, spread one third of the strawberry buttercream onto another of the cakes and top with the remaining strawberry slices. Carefully stack the two filled layers with the final cake on top."},{"method":"STEP 7"},{"method":"Transfer the remaining buttercreams to disposable piping bags and snip off the ends. Pipe the strawberry buttercream in rings around the outside of the cake, starting at the base. Once you reach three quarters of the way up, switch to the lemon buttercream and continue piping onto the top of the cake. Smooth over the top using a palette knife then smooth the sides with either a large palette knife or, better still a pastry scraper. Use long sweeping movements and gently turn the cake turntable so that you get a smooth finish but a subtle gradient effect where the two colours meet. Scrape any excess icing into a bowl."},{"method":"STEP 8"},{"method":"To finish, top with the remaining soaked strawberry halves and the slices of cucumber."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"150g plain flour"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp cocoa powder"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp bicarbonate of soda"},{"ingredients":"50g butter , softened"},{"ingredients":"150g caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"1 large egg , beaten"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp vanilla paste"},{"ingredients":"100ml buttermilk or kefir"},{"ingredients":"50ml vegetable oil"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp white wine vinegar"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp red gel food colouring"},{"ingredients":"100g slightly salted butter , softened"},{"ingredients":"225g icing sugar"},{"ingredients":"100g full fat cream cheese , stirred to loosen"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Line a cupcake tin with 12 cupcake cases and set aside. Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Sieve the flour, cocoa, bicarb and a pinch of fine salt into a medium bowl and mix to combine."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Using a stand mixer or an electric hand whisk, beat together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy, then beat in the egg, vanilla, buttermilk, oil and vinegar until combined. Gradually mix the wet ingredients into the dried. Once combined, mix in the red food colouring until you have a deep red mix – the colour may vary depending on what brand you use."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Divide the batter between the cupcake cases and bake for 15 mins, or until a skewer inserted into the centre of a cake comes out clean."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"While the cakes are cooling, make the icing. Beat together the butter and icing sugar using an electric whisk or by hand until pale and fluffy, about 3 mins, then beat in the cream cheese for a further 1-2 mins until well combined."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"Once the cakes are cool, use a piping bag fitted with a star nozzle to cover the cakes with the cream cheese icing, or dollop the icing on top using a spoon."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"200ml semi-skimmed milk"},{"ingredients":"85g unsalted butter"},{"ingredients":"2 large eggs"},{"ingredients":"550g strong white bread flour , plus extra for kneading if doing it by hand"},{"ingredients":"2½ tsp fast-action dried yeast"},{"ingredients":"50g golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"oil , for greasing"},{"ingredients":"125g unsalted butter , plus extra for greasing"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp ground cinnamon"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp ground ginger"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp ground nutmeg"},{"ingredients":"225g light muscovado sugar"},{"ingredients":"140g pecans , toasted then roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"100g icing sugar , sifted"},{"ingredients":"½ tsp vanilla extract"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp semi-skimmed milk"},{"ingredients":"pinch of ground cinnamon"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp unsalted butter , melted"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Start with the dough. Put the milk and butter into a medium pan and heat gently until the butter melts and the milk is at a simmer. Cool for a few mins, then beat in the eggs with a fork. Mix the dry ingredients in a large bowl with 1½ tsp fine salt, then add the liquid and stir to a sticky dough. Leave for 5 mins, then tip onto a floured worktop and knead for 5-10 mins until smooth and springy. Use a little oil to grease a large bowl, add the dough, turn it in the oil to coat, then cover the bowl with clingfilm. Leave in a warm place for 1 hr or until doubled in size. Knead in a tabletop mixer with a dough hook if you prefer."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"To assemble, grease a 25cm bundt pan with butter. Melt the rest of the butter in a pan. In a medium bowl mix the spices and sugar plus a pinch of salt. Spoon 2 tbsp melted butter, 3 tbsp spiced sugar and 4 tbsp pecans into the bottom of the tin."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Pull the dough into about 65 small pieces and roll into balls. Taking 4 or 5 at a time, dunk the dough balls into the melted butter, let the excess drain off, then tip them into the spiced sugar. Roll to coat, then put haphazardly into the tin. Repeat until there’s a full layer of dough in the tin. Scatter with the rest of the chopped nuts, then carry on filling the tin with the coated dough balls. Tip any leftover sugar and butter over the dough. Can be frozen now for up to 1 month. Defrost in the fridge then let prove."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Cover the pan with oiled clingfilm then leave to rise in a warm place for 1 hr, or until risen and the dough no longer springs back when you poke it."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"Heat the oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Bake the monkey bread for 35 mins, or until well risen and golden. Let the pan cool for 5 mins, then give it a sharp rap on the counter. Leave in the tin until just warm."},{"method":"STEP 6"},{"method":"Whisk all of the ingredients together to make the glaze. It will thicken as the melted butter cools. Turn the monkey bread onto a serving plate, then drizzle with the glaze. Let it set, if you can bear the wait."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"250g butter , softened (plus extra for the tin)"},{"ingredients":"4 large eggs"},{"ingredients":"250g golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"250g self-raising flour"},{"ingredients":"½ tsp baking powder"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp vanilla extract"},{"ingredients":"6 tbsp coffee liqueur"},{"ingredients":"100g butter , softened"},{"ingredients":"100g icing sugar"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp milk"},{"ingredients":"6 tsp chocolate spread"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp instant espresso powder"},{"ingredients":"1kg pack fondant icing sugar"},{"ingredients":"chocolate-covered coffee beans and melted chocolate"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Butter a 30 x 20cm tin and line with baking parchment. Put the cake ingredients in a bowl except for the liqueur. Whisk until smooth using an electric whisk, then transfer to the tin, smooth out and bake for 30-35mins until a skewer inserted in the centre comes out clean. Leave to cool completely."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Meanwhile, for the filling, whisk the butter, icing sugar and milk together until smooth, then transfer to a piping bag."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"When the cake is cold, slice off the top so it’s flat, turn over, trim and cut into neat, approx. 4cm squares (four squares across and seven down). You should have 28. Dip each one briefly in the liqueur and sit dipped-side up. Put a tiny dot of chocolate spread on top of each cake, then pipe a raspberry-sized ball of the buttercream filling on top of each one."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"For the icing, mix the espresso powder with 1 tsp water to dissolve, then mix with the fondant icing sugar and enough water to make it a condensed milk consistency. Put the cakes on wire racks set over trays to catch the drips, then coat each one in the icing. The best way to do this is to hold each one over the bowl of icing on a slotted spoon then generously drizzle over the icing with a tablespoon. Remove from the slotted spoon with a cutlery knife and sit on the rack to dry. Decorate with a drizzle of melted chocolate and a chocolate- covered coffee bean. Serve in cake cases, if you like. Will keep for two days in an airtight container. \nWhy not also try our piña colada and strawberry daiquiri fancies?"}]

recipe: Classic scones with jam & clotted cream
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"350g self-raising flour, plus more for dusting"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp baking powder"},{"ingredients":"85g butter, cut into cubes"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"175ml milk"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp vanilla extract"},{"ingredients":"squeeze lemon juice  (see tips below)"},{"ingredients":"beaten egg, to glaze"},{"ingredients":"jam and clotted cream, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oven to 220C/200C fan/gas 7. Tip the self-raising flour into a large bowl with ¼ tsp salt and the baking powder, then mix."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add the butter, then rub in with your fingers until the mix looks like fine crumbs. Stir in the caster sugar."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Put the milk into a jug and heat in the microwave for about 30 secs until warm, but not hot. Add the vanilla extract and a squeeze of lemon juice, then set aside for a moment."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Put a baking tray in the oven. Make a well in the dry mix, then add the liquid and combine it quickly with a cutlery knife – it will seem pretty wet at first."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"Scatter some flour onto the work surface and tip the dough out. Dredge the dough and your hands with a little more flour, then fold the dough over 2-3 times until it’s a little smoother. Pat into a round about 4cm deep. Take a 5cm cutter (smooth-edged cutters tend to cut more cleanly, giving a better rise) and dip it into some flour. Plunge into the dough, then repeat until you have four scones. You may need to press what’s left of the dough back into a round to cut out another four."},{"method":"STEP 6"},{"method":"Brush the tops with a beaten egg, then carefully arrange on the hot baking tray. Bake for 10 mins until risen and golden on the top. Eat just warm or cold on the day of baking, generously topped with jam and clotted cream. If freezing, freeze once cool. Defrost, then put in a low oven (about 160C/140C fan/gas 3) for a few minutes to refresh."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"300g self-raising flour"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp bicarbonate of soda"},{"ingredients":"100g light muscovado sugar"},{"ingredients":"50g porridge oats, plus 1 tbsp for topping"},{"ingredients":"2 medium bananas, the riper the better"},{"ingredients":"284ml carton buttermilk"},{"ingredients":"5 tbsp light olive oil"},{"ingredients":"2 egg whites"},{"ingredients":"150g punnet blueberries"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 180C/fan 160C/gas 4 and line a 12-hole muffin tin with paper muffin cases. Tip the flour and bicarbonate of soda into a large bowl. Hold back 1 tbsp of the sugar, then mix the remainder with the flour and 50g oats. Make a well in the centre. In a separate bowl, mash the bananas until nearly smooth. Stir the buttermilk, oil and egg whites into the mashed banana until evenly combined."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Pour the liquid mixture into the well and stir quickly and sparingly with a wooden spoon. The mix will look lumpy and may have the odd fleck of flour still visible, but don’t be tempted to over-mix. Tip in the blueberries and give it just one more stir. Divide the mix between the muffin cases – they will be quite full – then sprinkle the tops with the final tbsp of the oats and the rest of he sugar. Bake for 18-20 mins until risen and dark golden. Cool for 5 mins in the tray before lifting out onto a rack to cool completely."}]

recipe: Classic scones with jam & clotted cream
name: Classic scones with jam & clotted cream

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"450g strong white flour , plus extra for dusting"},{"ingredients":"7g fast action yeast"},{"ingredients":"75g caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"165ml warm milk"},{"ingredients":"1 large  egg , beaten plus 1 for egg wash"},{"ingredients":"50g unsalted butter , melted, plus extra for the tray"},{"ingredients":"5 tbsp lemon curd"},{"ingredients":"150g sultanas"},{"ingredients":"250g icing sugar"},{"ingredients":"12 glacé cherries"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Mix the flour, yeast, caster sugar and 1 tsp sea salt in a large bowl. Make a well in the centre and pour in the warm milk, beaten egg and melted butter. Mix well a soft dough forms. If it feels dry, add a bit of warm water, if it feels too sticky and wet, add 1 tbsp flour."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Dust a work surface with flour and tip the mixture onto it. Knead the dough until it feels smooth and elastic. Shape into a ball and put in a large, lightly floured bowl. Cover and leave to rise in a warm place for 1 hr or until doubled in size. Or, leave to prove in the fridge overnight, removing 45 mins before continuing."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Line a large baking tray with non-stick baking paper. Lightly dust a work surface and roll out the dough to 30 x 45cm. Evenly spread the lemon curd over the dough and sprinkle with the sultanas. Roll the dough up lengthways from the shortest side, like a Swiss roll, to form a log. Cut into 12 equal sized buns with a sharp knife, egg-washing the loose end of the pastry and pressing it down, so it doesn’t unravel. Arrange, spread apart, on the prepared baking tray, cover, and leave to prove for 45 mins until doubled in size."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Heat the oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Brush the buns with a little egg wash. Bake for 10 mins, then reduce the temperature to 180C/160C fan/gas 4 and cook for a further 10 mins. Leave to cool."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"Meanwhile, sieve the icing sugar and mix with 3 tbsp water until a thick, white icing forms. Spread the icing on top of the buns with the back of a spoon, then put a cherry in the middle of each one."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"a little dairy-free sunflower spread, for greasing"},{"ingredients":"1 large ripe avocado (about 150g)"},{"ingredients":"300g light muscovado sugar"},{"ingredients":"350g gluten-free plain flour"},{"ingredients":"50g good-quality cocoa powder"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp bicarbonate of soda"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp gluten-free baking powder"},{"ingredients":"400ml unsweetened soya milk"},{"ingredients":"150ml vegetable oil"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp vanilla extract"},{"ingredients":"85g ripe avocado flesh, mashed"},{"ingredients":"85g dairy-free sunflower spread"},{"ingredients":"200g dairy-free chocolate, 70% cocoa, broken into chunks"},{"ingredients":"25g cocoa powder"},{"ingredients":"125ml unsweetened soya milk"},{"ingredients":"200g icing sugar, sifted"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp vanilla extract"},{"ingredients":"gluten-free and vegan sprinkles, to decorate"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 160C/140C fan/gas 3. Grease two 20cm sandwich tins with a little dairy-free sunflower spread, then line the bases with baking parchment."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Put 1 large avocado and 300g light muscovado sugar in a food processor and whizz until smooth."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Add 350g gluten-free plain flour, 50g cocoa powder, 1 tsp bicarbonate of soda, 2 tsp gluten-free baking powder, 400ml unsweetened soya milk, 150ml vegetable oil and 2 tsp vanilla extract to the bowl with ½ tsp fine salt and process again to a velvety, liquid batter."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Divide between the tins and bake for 25 mins or until fully risen and a skewer inserted into the middle of the cakes comes out clean."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"Cool in the tins for 5 mins, then turn the cakes onto a rack to cool completely."},{"method":"STEP 6"},{"method":"While you wait, start preparing the frosting. Beat together 85g ripe avocado flesh and 85g dairy-free sunflower spread with electric beaters until creamy and smooth. Pass through a sieve and set aside."},{"method":"STEP 7"},{"method":"Melt 200g dairy-free chocolate, either over a bowl of water or in the microwave, then let it cool for a few mins."},{"method":"STEP 8"},{"method":"Sift 25g cocoa powder into a large bowl. Bring 125ml unsweetened soya milk to a simmer, then gradually beat into the cocoa until smooth. Cool for a few mins."},{"method":"STEP 9"},{"method":"Tip in the avocado mix, 200g sifted icing sugar, melted chocolate and 1 tsp vanilla, and keep mixing to make a shiny, thick frosting. Use this to sandwich and top the cake."},{"method":"STEP 10"},{"method":"Cover with sprinkles or your own decoration, then leave to set for 10 mins before slicing. Can be made 2 days ahead."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"225g unsalted butter,  softened"},{"ingredients":"225g caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"4 eggs"},{"ingredients":"225g self-raising flour"},{"ingredients":"1 lemon, zested"},{"ingredients":"1½ lemons, juiced"},{"ingredients":"85g caster sugar"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Beat together the butter and caster sugar until pale and creamy, then add the eggs, one at a time, slowly mixing through."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Sift in the self-raising flour, then add the lemon zest and mix until well combined."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Line a loaf tin (8 x 21cm) with greaseproof paper, then spoon in the mixture and level the top with a spoon."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"Bake for 45-50 mins until a thin skewer inserted into the centre of the cake comes out clean."},{"method":"STEP 6"},{"method":"While the cake is cooling in its tin, mix together the lemons juice and caster sugar to make the drizzle."},{"method":"STEP 7"},{"method":"Prick the warm cake all over with a skewer or fork, then pour over the drizzle – the juice will sink in and the sugar will form a lovely, crisp topping."},{"method":"STEP 8"},{"method":"Leave in the tin until completely cool, then remove and serve. Will keep in an airtight container for 3-4 days, or freeze for up to 1 month."}]

recipe: Triple chocolate & peanut butter layer cake
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"225ml rapeseed oil, plus more for the tins"},{"ingredients":"250g self-raising flour"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp cocoa"},{"ingredients":"1 ½ tsp bicarbonate of soda"},{"ingredients":"225g caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp golden syrup"},{"ingredients":"3 large eggs, beaten"},{"ingredients":"225ml milk"},{"ingredients":"200g dark chocolate, chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp chocolate chips"},{"ingredients":"small handful pretzel pieces"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp honeycomb pieces"},{"ingredients":"65g dark chocolate"},{"ingredients":"250g soft salted butter"},{"ingredients":"500g icing sugar"},{"ingredients":"45g smooth peanut butter"},{"ingredients":"1-2 tbsp cocoa"},{"ingredients":"200ml double cream"},{"ingredients":"100g dark chocolate, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"chocolate eggs, some hollow, some filled, gold lustre, toffee popcorn and pretzels"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Oil and line the base of three 19cm sandwich tins. Mix the flour, cocoa, bicarb and sugar in a bowl. Make a well in the centre and beat in the syrup, eggs, oil and milk with an electric whisk until smooth."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Divide the mix between the tins, and bake for 25-30 mins until the cakes are risen and firm to the touch. Cool in the tins for 10 mins before turning out onto a cooling rack and cooling completely. At this stage, they can be frozen, well wrapped, for up to eight weeks."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Make the bark while the cake is cooling. Melt the chocolate in short bursts in the microwave, stirring every 20 secs, until smooth. Spoon onto a parchment-lined baking tray and smooth over with a spatula to make a thinnish layer, around 35 x 20cm. Sprinkle over the chocolate chips along with the pieces of pretzel and honeycomb, then chill until solid. Remove the bark from the fridge and leave for a minute to come to room temperature before using a sharp knife to cut it into shards (if it’s fridge cold, the chocolate will snap rather than cut). Chill again until you’re ready to decorate the cake."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"To make the icing, melt the chocolate in the microwave, stirring between short blasts, then leave to cool a little. Meanwhile, beat the butter, icing sugar and 1 tbsp boiling water with an electric whisk or stand mixer, slowly at first, then turn up the speed and beat until you get a pale, fluffy icing. Spoon out a third of the mix into a separate bowl and stir in the peanut butter. Whisk the melted chocolate into the remainder of the icing, then beat in the cocoa if you want a darker, more chocolatey-coloured icing."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"Sandwich the three cakes together with the peanut butter icing. Use half the chocolate icing to coat the sides and top of the cake and fill in the edges between the layers, scraping off any excess. Chill for 20 mins. This is called a crumb coating, allowing you to get a really smooth finish when it comes to the final icing."},{"method":"STEP 6"},{"method":"Spread the remaining chocolate icing over the lightly chilled cake, smoothing over the sides and top so you get a neat finish. Chill again for 20 mins."},{"method":"STEP 7"},{"method":"To make the ganache, heat the cream in a small pan until steaming. Tip the dark chocolate into a bowl, then pour over the cream. Mix well until smooth and shiny. Transfer to a piping bag and leave to cool for a few mins at room temperature."},{"method":"STEP 8"},{"method":"Pipe the ganache on top of the cake, nudging it over the edge and allowing it to drip down neatly. Do this all the way round the cake, then fill in the centre with more ganache. Smooth the top with a knife. Chill for 1 hr for the ganache to set."},{"method":"STEP 9"},{"method":"Press the bark shards into the cake, sticking up. Add lots of chocolate eggs, popcorn and pretzels in and around the shards. Cut into slices to serve. Will keep for up to three days kept in a cool place in an airtight container."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"250g jumbo porridge oats"},{"ingredients":"125g butter, plus extra for the tin"},{"ingredients":"125g light brown sugar"},{"ingredients":"2-3 tbsp golden syrup (depending on how gooey you want it)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Put the oats, butter, sugar and golden syrup in a food processor and pulse until mixed – be careful not to overmix or the oats may lose their texture."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Lightly butter a 20 x 20cm baking tin and add the mixture. Press into the corners with the back of a spoon so the mixture is flat and score into 12 squares. Bake for around 15 mins until golden brown."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"200g dark chocolate (about 60% cocoa solids), chopped"},{"ingredients":"200g butter, cubed"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp instant coffee granules"},{"ingredients":"85g self-raising flour"},{"ingredients":"85g plain flour"},{"ingredients":"¼ tsp bicarbonate of soda"},{"ingredients":"200g light muscovado sugar"},{"ingredients":"200g golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"25g cocoa powder"},{"ingredients":"3 medium  eggs"},{"ingredients":"75ml buttermilk"},{"ingredients":"50g grated chocolate or 100g curls, to decorate"},{"ingredients":"200g dark chocolate (about 60% cocoa solids), chopped"},{"ingredients":"300ml double cream"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":""}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oven to 160C/fan 140C/gas 3. Butter and line a 20cm round cake tin (7.5cm deep)."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Put 200g chopped dark chocolate in a medium pan with 200g butter."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Mix 1 tbsp instant coffee granules into 125ml cold water and pour into the pan."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Warm through over a low heat just until everything is melted – don’t overheat. Or melt in the microwave for about 5 minutes, stirring halfway through."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"Mix 85g self-raising flour, 85g plain flour, ¼ tsp bicarbonate of soda, 200g light muscovado sugar, 200g golden caster sugar and 25g cocoa powder, and squash out any lumps."},{"method":"STEP 6"},{"method":"Beat 3 medium eggs with 75ml buttermilk."},{"method":"STEP 7"},{"method":"Pour the melted chocolate mixture and the egg mixture into the flour mixture and stir everything to a smooth, quite runny consistency."},{"method":"STEP 8"},{"method":"Pour this into the tin and bake for 1hr 25 – 1hr 30 mins. If you push a skewer into the centre it should come out clean and the top should feel firm (don’t worry if it cracks a bit)."},{"method":"STEP 9"},{"method":"Leave to cool in the tin (don’t worry if it dips slightly), then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely. Cut the cold cake horizontally into three."},{"method":"STEP 10"},{"method":"To make the ganache, put 200g chopped dark chocolate in a bowl.  Pour 300ml double cream into a pan, add 2 tbsp golden caster sugar and heat until it is about to boil."},{"method":"STEP 11"},{"method":"Take off the heat and pour it over the chocolate. Stir until the chocolate has melted and the mixture is smooth. Cool until it is a little thicker but still pourable."},{"method":"STEP 12"},{"method":"Sandwich the layers together with just a little of the ganache. Pour the rest over the cake letting it fall down the sides and smooth over any gaps with a palette knife."},{"method":"STEP 13"},{"method":"Decorate with 50g grated chocolate or 100g chocolate curls. The cake keeps moist and gooey for 3-4 days."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"500g white or wholemeal bread"},{"ingredients":"500g/1lb 2oz mixed dried fruit"},{"ingredients":"85g mixed peel"},{"ingredients":"1½ tbsp mixed spice"},{"ingredients":"600ml milk"},{"ingredients":"2 large  eggs, beaten"},{"ingredients":"140g light muscovado sugar"},{"ingredients":"zest 1 lemon (optional)"},{"ingredients":"100g butter, melted"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp demerara sugar"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Tear 500g white or wholemeal bread into a large mixing bowl and add 500g mixed dried fruit, 85g mixed peel and 1 ½ tbsp mixed spice."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Pour in 600ml milk, then stir or scrunch through your fingers to mix everything well and completely break up the bread."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Add 2 beaten large eggs, 140g light muscovado sugar and zest of 1 lemon, if using. Stir well, then set aside for 15 mins to soak."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Butter and line the base of a 20cm non-stick square cake tin (not one with a loose base)."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"Stir the melted butter into the pudding mixture, tip into the tin, then scatter with demerara."},{"method":"STEP 6"},{"method":"Bake for 1½ hrs until firm and golden, covering with foil if it starts to brown too much. Turn out of the tin and strip off the paper. Cut into squares and serve warm."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"200g pack  butter , softened"},{"ingredients":"200g soft  brown sugar"},{"ingredients":"2 eggs"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp vanilla extract"},{"ingredients":"200g self-raising flour"},{"ingredients":"140g oats"},{"ingredients":"50g chopped nuts such as pecan , hazelnuts or almonds"},{"ingredients":"50g desiccated coconut"},{"ingredients":"50g raisin , or mixed fruit"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"When the butter is really soft, tip it into a bowl along with the sugar. Using an electric hand whisk or exercising some arm muscle, beat together until the sugar is mixed through. Beat in the eggs, one at a time, followed by the vanilla extract and a pinch of salt, if you like. Stir in the flour and oats. The mixture will be quite stiff at this point. Now decide what else you would like to add – any or all of the flavours are delicious – and stir through."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Tear off an A4-size sheet of greaseproof paper. Pile up half the mixture in the middle of the sheet, then use a spoon to thickly spread the mixture along the centre of the paper. Pull over one edge of paper and roll up until you get a tight cylinder. If you have problems getting it smooth, then roll as you would a rolling pin along a kitchen surface. You’ll need it to be about the width of a teacup. When it is tightly wrapped, twist up the ends and then place in the freezer. Can be frozen for up to 3 months."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"To cook, heat oven to 180C/fan 160C/gas 4 and unwrap the frozen biscuit mix. Using a sharp knife, cut off a disk about ½cm wide. If you have difficulty slicing through, dip the knife into a cup of hot water. Cut off as many biscuits as you need, then pop the mix back into the freezer for another time. Place on a baking sheet, spacing them widely apart as the mixture will spread when cooking, then cook for 15 mins until the tops are golden brown. Leave to cool for at least 5 mins before eating."}]

recipe: Sticky stem ginger cake with lemon icing
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"225g self-raising flour"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp bicarbonate of soda"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp ground ginger"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp ground cinnamon"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp ground mixed spice"},{"ingredients":"115g butter, cut into cubes, plus extra for greasing"},{"ingredients":"115g dark muscovado sugar"},{"ingredients":"115g black treacle"},{"ingredients":"115g golden syrup"},{"ingredients":"250ml whole milk"},{"ingredients":"85g drained stem ginger, finely grated"},{"ingredients":"1 egg"},{"ingredients":"50g icing  sugar, sifted"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp finely grated lemon zest"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp lemon juice"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Preheat the oven to fan 160C/conventional 180C/gas 4. Butter and line an 18cm round, 7cm deep cake tin with greaseproof or parchment paper."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Put the flour, bicarbonate of soda and all the spices into a large mixing bowl. Add the butter and rub it into the flour with your fingertips until the mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Put the sugar, treacle, syrup and milk in a medium saucepan and heat, gently stirring until the sugar has dissolved. Turn up the heat and bring the mixture to just below boiling point."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Add the stem ginger to the flour mixture, then pour in the treacle mixture, stirring as you go with a wooden spoon. Break in the egg and beat until all the mixture is combined and it resembles a thick pancake batter. Pour this into prepared tin and bake for 50 minutes-1 hour, until a skewer pushed into the centre of the cake comes out fairly clean. Leave to cool completely in tin before turning cake out. (To freeze: wrap in greaseproof paper, then in cling film. Freeze for up to 1 month.)"},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"To make the icing, mix together icing sugar and lemon zest, then gradually add lemon juice until you have a smooth, slightly runny icing, adding more juice, if needed. Drizzle icing in a zig-zag pattern over surface of cake, turn cake around and drizzle again to create the cross-hatched finish (see below). Cake keeps for up to 2 weeks stored in an airtight container."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"35 cardamom pods"},{"ingredients":"350ml full-fat milk"},{"ingredients":"200g butter , cubed"},{"ingredients":"500g strong white bread flour , plus extra for dusting"},{"ingredients":"225g golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"7g sachet fast-action dried yeast"},{"ingredients":"½ tsp ground cinnamon"},{"ingredients":"vegetable oil or sunflower oil, for greasing"},{"ingredients":"1 large egg , beaten"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp pearl sugar (available from ocado.com)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Crack open 10 of the cardamom pods with a pestle and mortar, and tip into a saucepan. Add the milk and warm until steaming but not boiling. Add 50g butter (leave the remaining butter at room temperature to soften) and set aside to cool until lukewarm, swirling the pan from time to time to encourage the butter to melt."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Put the flour, 75g of the sugar, the yeast, cinnamon and 1 /2 tsp salt into a large bowl, or the bowl of a freestanding mixer. Mix until well combined. When the milk has cooled, strain it through a sieve into the flour, discarding the cardamom. Using a wooden spoon or dough hook, mix to form a soft dough. Tip onto a work surface and knead for 10 mins, or run the freestanding mixer for 5 mins, until the dough is smooth and stretchy. Clean the bowl, lightly grease with oil, then return the dough to the bowl and turn it over until well coated in oil. Cover the bowl with a tea towel or cling film and leave to rise for 2 hrs or until doubled in size (you could prove it in the fridge overnight)."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Crack the remaining cardamom pods using a pestle and mortar. Prise them open and tip the seeds back into the mortar, discarding the pods. Crush the seeds to a powder, then combine with 150g sugar. In a bowl, mix the remaining butter with all but 2 tbsp of the cardamom sugar."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Line two baking trays with parchment. Punch the dough down to knock out the air, then roll to a rectangle roughly 35 x 45cm, with the longer edge facing you. Spread the cardamom butter over the surface, right to the edges. Fold the top third down to the middle and the bottom third up, like an envelope, so you have three layers of dough. Score, then cut into 12 equal strips, measuring about 3.5 x 11cm each. Cut each strip down the centre, leaving it attached at the top. Twist each strip away from the centre two or three times, then tie the dough in a knot and tuck the ends underneath the bun. Put each on the tray when done."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"Cover both trays with a sheet of lightly oiled cling film and leave somewhere warm to rise for 30 mins - 1 hr, or until almost doubled in size. Heat oven to 190C/170C fan/gas 5."},{"method":"STEP 6"},{"method":"Uncover the buns and brush all over with the beaten egg, then sprinkle with the pearl sugar. Bake for 20-25 mins until golden brown – swap the trays halfway through if they’re browning unevenly."},{"method":"STEP 7"},{"method":"Tip the remaining cardamom sugar into a pan and add 50ml water. Bring to a boil, then remove from the heat and set aside to cool, swirling to dissolve the sugar. Brush the syrup over the buns two or three times as they cool, leave them to soak for 20 mins before eating. Will keep for 2 days in a sealed container, or freeze for 2 months. Defrost at room temperature and reheat for 5 mins in the oven before eating."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"50g melted butter, for brushing"},{"ingredients":"cocoa powder, for dusting"},{"ingredients":"200g good-quality dark chocolate, chopped into small pieces"},{"ingredients":"200g butter, in small pieces"},{"ingredients":"200g golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"4 eggs and 4 yolks"},{"ingredients":"200g plain flour"},{"ingredients":"Caramel sauce (see 'Goes well with') and vanilla ice cream or orange sorbet, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"First get your moulds ready. Using upward strokes, heavily brush melted butter (use 50g in total) all over the inside of the pudding mould. Place the mould in the fridge or freezer. Brush more melted butter over the chilled butter, then add a good spoonful of cocoa powder into the mould. Tip the mould so the powder completely coats the butter. Tap any excess cocoa back into the jar, then repeat with the next mould."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Place a bowl over a pan of barely simmering water, then slowly melt 200g good-quality dark chocolate and 200g butter, both chopped into small pieces, together. Remove the bowl from the heat and stir until smooth. Leave to cool for about 10 mins."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"In a separate bowl whisk 4 eggs and 4 egg yolks together with 200g golden caster sugar until thick and pale and the whisk leaves a trail; use an electric whisk if you want. Sift 200g plain flour into the eggs, then beat together."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Pour the melted chocolate into the egg mixture in thirds, beating well between each addition, until all the chocolate is added and the mixture is completely combined to a loose cake batter."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"Tip the fondant batter into a jug, then evenly divide between the moulds. The fondants can now be frozen for up to a month and cooked from frozen. Chill for at least 20 mins or up to the night before. To bake from frozen, simply carry on as stated, adding 5 mins more to the cooking time."},{"method":"STEP 6"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/fan 180C/gas 6. Place the fondants on a baking tray, then cook for 10-12 mins until the tops have formed a crust and they are starting to come away from the sides of their moulds. Remove from the oven, then leave to sit for 1 min before turning out."},{"method":"STEP 7"},{"method":"Loosen the fondants by moving the tops very gently so they come away from the sides, easing them out of the moulds. Tip each fondant slightly onto your hand so you know it has come away, then tip back into the mould ready to plate up."},{"method":"STEP 8"},{"method":"Starting from the middle of each plate, squeeze a spiral of caramel sauce – do all the plates you need before you go on to the next stage."},{"method":"STEP 9"},{"method":"Sit a fondant in the middle of each plate. Using a large spoon dipped in hot water, scoop a ‘quenelle’ of ice cream."},{"method":"STEP 10"},{"method":"Carefully place the ice cream on top of the fondant, then serve immediately. Repeat with the rest of the fondants."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"185g unsalted butter"},{"ingredients":"185g best dark chocolate"},{"ingredients":"85g plain flour"},{"ingredients":"40g cocoa powder"},{"ingredients":"50g white chocolate"},{"ingredients":"50g milk chocolate"},{"ingredients":"3 large eggs"},{"ingredients":"275g golden caster sugar"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Cut 185g unsalted butter into small cubes and tip into a medium bowl. Break 185g dark chocolate into small pieces and drop into the bowl."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Fill a small saucepan about a quarter full with hot water, then sit the bowl on top so it rests on the rim of the pan, not touching the water. Put over a low heat until the butter and chocolate have melted, stirring occasionally to mix them."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Remove the bowl from the pan. Alternatively, cover the bowl loosely with cling film and put in the microwave for 2 minutes on High. Leave the melted mixture to cool to room temperature."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"While you wait for the chocolate to cool, position a shelf in the middle of your oven and turn the oven on to 180C/160C fan/gas 4."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"Using a shallow 20cm square tin, cut out a square of non-stick baking parchment to line the base. Tip 85g plain flour and 40g cocoa powder into a sieve held over a medium bowl. Tap and shake the sieve so they run through together and you get rid of any lumps."},{"method":"STEP 6"},{"method":"Chop 50g white chocolate and 50g milk chocolate into chunks on a board."},{"method":"STEP 7"},{"method":"Break 3 large eggs into a large bowl and tip in 275g golden caster sugar. With an electric mixer on maximum speed, whisk the eggs and sugar. They will look thick and creamy, like a milk shake. This can take 3-8 minutes, depending on how powerful your mixer is. You’ll know it’s ready when the mixture becomes really pale and about double its original volume. Another check is to turn off the mixer, lift out the beaters and wiggle them from side to side. If the mixture that runs off the beaters leaves a trail on the surface of the mixture in the bowl for a second or two, you’re there."},{"method":"STEP 8"},{"method":"Pour the cooled chocolate mixture over the eggy mousse, then gently fold together with a rubber spatula. Plunge the spatula in at one side, take it underneath and bring it up the opposite side and in again at the middle. Continue going under and over in a figure of eight, moving the bowl round after each folding so you can get at it from all sides, until the two mixtures are one and the colour is a mottled dark brown. The idea is to marry them without knocking out the air, so be as gentle and slow as you like."},{"method":"STEP 9"},{"method":"Hold the sieve over the bowl of eggy chocolate mixture and resift the cocoa and flour mixture, shaking the sieve from side to side, to cover the top evenly."},{"method":"STEP 10"},{"method":"Gently fold in this powder using the same figure of eight action as before. The mixture will look dry and dusty at first, and a bit unpromising, but if you keep going very gently and patiently, it will end up looking gungy and fudgy. Stop just before you feel you should, as you don’t want to overdo this mixing."},{"method":"STEP 11"},{"method":"Finally, stir in the white and milk chocolate chunks until they’re dotted throughout."},{"method":"STEP 12"},{"method":"Pour the mixture into the prepared tin, scraping every bit out of the bowl with the spatula. Gently ease the mixture into the corners of the tin and paddle the spatula from side to side across the top to level it."},{"method":"STEP 13"},{"method":"Put in the oven and set your timer for 25 mins. When the buzzer goes, open the oven, pull the shelf out a bit and gently shake the tin. If the brownie wobbles in the middle, it’s not quite done, so slide it back in and bake for another 5 minutes until the top has a shiny, papery crust and the sides are just beginning to come away from the tin. Take out of the oven."},{"method":"STEP 14"},{"method":"Leave the whole thing in the tin until completely cold, then, if you’re using the brownie tin, lift up the protruding rim slightly and slide the uncut brownie out on its base. If you’re using a normal tin, lift out the brownie with the foil. Cut into quarters, then cut each quarter into four squares and finally into triangles."},{"method":"STEP 15"},{"method":"They’ll keep in an airtight container for a good two weeks and in the freezer for up to a month."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"140g dried pitted whole dates preferably Medjool, chopped into small pieces"},{"ingredients":"75ml rapeseed oil , plus a few drops for greasing"},{"ingredients":"75g black treacle"},{"ingredients":"50g maple syrup"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp finely grated fresh ginger"},{"ingredients":"1 large egg"},{"ingredients":"175ml buttermilk"},{"ingredients":"250g plain flour"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp bicarbonate of soda"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp ground ginger"},{"ingredients":"½ tsp ground cinnamon"},{"ingredients":"50g dark muscovado sugar"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the dates in a small bowl and pour over 125ml of boiling water. Leave to cool for 30 mins. Lightly oil a 28 x 19 x 3cm traybake tin, then line the base with baking parchment."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Meanwhile, put the oil, black treacle, maple syrup and freshly grated ginger in a bowl and beat together with a fork to mix well. Set aside. Beat the egg in a small bowl and stir in the buttermilk. In a large bowl, mix the flour with the bicarbonate of soda, ground ginger, cinnamon and sugar – rub the mixture between your fingers to break down any lumpy bits of sugar. Heat oven to 160C/140C fan/gas 3."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Blend the dates and their liquid to a thick purée in a small food processor. Pour the egg, the dates and the treacle mixture into the bowl with the flour. Stir together briefly with a wooden spoon just until well mixed – the mixture will be soft like a thick batter. Pour it into the lined tin, gently level the mixture and bake for 40-45 mins. To test if it’s done, insert a skewer in the centre – if the skewer comes out clean with no uncooked mixture on it, and the cake feels firm but springy to the touch, it should be done."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Leave in the tin for a few mins before removing to a wire rack, peeling off the parchment and leaving to cool completely. If you can wait, wrap it well in parchment, then foil. Leave for a day before cutting, as it will become stickier – it will keep moist for 3-4 days."}]

recipe: Sticky stem ginger cake with lemon icing
name: Sticky stem ginger cake with lemon icing

recipe: Triple chocolate & peanut butter layer cake
name: Triple chocolate & peanut butter layer cake

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"300g Hob Nobs"},{"ingredients":"150g butter, melted"},{"ingredients":"1 x 397g can condensed milk (we used Nestlé)"},{"ingredients":"3 medium egg yolks"},{"ingredients":"finely grated zest and juice of 4 limes"},{"ingredients":"300ml double cream"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp icing sugar"},{"ingredients":"extra  lime zest, to decorate"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oven to 160C/fan 140C/gas 3."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Whizz 300g Hob Nobs to crumbs in a food processor (or put in a strong plastic bag and bash with a rolling pin)."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Mix with 150g melted butter and press into the base and up the sides of a 22cm loose-based tart tin. Bake in the oven for 10 minutes. Remove and cool."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Put 3 medium egg yolks in a large bowl and whisk for a minute with electric beaters."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"Add a can of condensed milk and whisk for 3 minutes, then add the finely grated zest and juice of 4 limes and whisk again for 3 minutes."},{"method":"STEP 6"},{"method":"Pour the filling into the cooled base then put back in the oven for 15 minutes. Cool then chill for at least 3 hours or overnight if you like. When you are ready to serve, carefully remove the pie from the tin and put on a serving plate."},{"method":"STEP 7"},{"method":"To decorate, softly whip together 300ml double cream and 1 tbsp icing sugar."},{"method":"STEP 8"},{"method":"Dollop or pipe the cream onto the top of the pie and finish with extra lime zest."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"140g ground almond"},{"ingredients":"140g butter, softened"},{"ingredients":"140g golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"140g self-raising flour"},{"ingredients":"2 eggs"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp vanilla extract"},{"ingredients":"250g raspberry"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp flaked almond"},{"ingredients":"icing sugar, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4 and base-line and grease a deep 20cm loose-bottomed cake tin. Blitz the ground almonds, butter, sugar, flour, eggs and vanilla extract in a food processor until well combined."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Spread half the mix over the cake tin and smooth over the top. Scatter the raspberries over, then dollop the remaining cake mixture on top and roughly spread – you might find this easier to do with your fingers. Scatter with flaked almonds and bake for 50 mins until golden. Cool, remove from the tin and dust with icing sugar to serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"225g butter, softened, plus extra for the tin"},{"ingredients":"450g cooking apples  (such as Bramley)"},{"ingredients":"½ lemon, juiced"},{"ingredients":"280g golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"4 eggs"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp  vanilla extract"},{"ingredients":"350g self-raising flour"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp  baking powder"},{"ingredients":"demerara sugar, to sprinkle"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Butter and line a rectangular baking tin (approx 27 x 20cm) with  baking parchment. Peel, core and thinly slice the apples, then squeeze over the lemon juice. Set aside."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Put the butter, caster sugar, eggs, vanilla, flour and baking powder into a large bowl and mix well until smooth. Spread half the mixture into the prepared tin. Arrange half the apples over the top of the mixture, then repeat the layers. Sprinkle over the demerara sugar."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Bake for 45-50 mins until golden and springy to the touch. Leave to cool for 10 mins, then turn out of the tin and remove the paper. Cut into bars or squares."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"250g pack unsalted butter, softened, plus extra for greasing"},{"ingredients":"250g golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"seeds scraped from 1 vanilla pod or 1 tsp vanilla paste"},{"ingredients":"5 large eggs, cracked into a jug"},{"ingredients":"85g plain flour"},{"ingredients":"100g full-fat Greek yogurt (I used Total)"},{"ingredients":"250g self-raising flour"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp semi-skimmed milk"},{"ingredients":"50g golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"seeds ½ vanilla pod or ½ tsp vanilla paste"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 160C/140C fan/gas 3. Grease a round, deep 20cm tin, then line the base and sides with non-stick baking paper."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Using electric beaters or a tabletop mixer, beat the butter, sugar, vanilla and ¼ tsp salt together until pale and fluffy, then pour in the eggs, one at a time, giving the mix a really good beating before adding the next."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Add 1 tbsp of the plain flour if the mix starts to look slimy rather than fluffy. Beat in the yogurt. Mix the flours; then, using a large metal spoon, fold them into the batter, followed by the milk."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Spoon the mix into the tin and bake for 1 hr 20 mins or until well risen and golden – a skewer inserted into the middle should come out clean."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"Meanwhile, make the syrup by gently heating 50ml water with the sugar and vanilla in a pan until the sugar dissolves. Set aside. Once the cake is out of the oven, leave to cool for 30 mins in the tin, then use a skewer to poke holes all over the cake, going right to the bottom. Pour the syrup over, letting it completely soak in after each addition."},{"method":"STEP 6"},{"method":"Leave to cool completely, then either wrap the cake well or fill and ice it. If you wrap it with baking parchment and cling film, the unfilled cake will keep well for up to 3 days, or in the freezer for up to a month."},{"method":"STEP 7"},{"method":"For ideas on how to decorate the cake and to try out some variations on this basic cake mixture, have a look at the 'Goes well with' recipes for Simple elegance wedding cake, Birthday bug cake and Summer celebration cake."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"100g butter"},{"ingredients":"125g caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"75g light brown or muscovado sugar"},{"ingredients":"125g plain chocolate (plain or milk)"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp golden syrup"},{"ingredients":"2 eggs"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp vanilla extract/essence"},{"ingredients":"100g plain flour"},{"ingredients":"½ tsp baking powder"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp cocoa powder"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 180C/fan 160C/gas 4. Grease and line a 20cm cake tin."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Place the butter, caster sugar, brown sugar, chocolate and golden syrup in the pan and melt gently on a low heat until it is smooth and lump-free."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Remove the pan from the heat."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Break the eggs into the bowl and whisk with the fork until light and frothy. 5 Add the eggs, vanilla extract or essence, flour, baking powder and cocoa powder to the chocolate mixture and mix thoroughly."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"Put the mixture into the greased and lined cake tin and place on the middle shelf of the oven. Bake for 25-30 mins."},{"method":"STEP 6"},{"method":"Remove and allow to cool for 20-30 mins before cutting into wedges and serving."},{"method":"STEP 7"},{"method":"Serve with cream or ice cream and plenty of fresh fruit."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"125g butter"},{"ingredients":"125g golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"225g plain flour"},{"ingredients":"½ egg or 1 egg yolk"},{"ingredients":"125g butter , at room temperature"},{"ingredients":"125g golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"3 medium eggs"},{"ingredients":"1 lemon , zested"},{"ingredients":"125g finely ground almonds or almond flour"},{"ingredients":"120g Fabbri amarena cherries (see tip)"},{"ingredients":"icing sugar , for dusting (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Mix together the butter, sugar, flour, a pinch of salt and the egg in a food processor to make a dough, then wrap and leave to rest in the fridge for 30 mins. The dough should be cold but still easy to work with by the time you roll it out."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Meanwhile, make the frangipane filling. Melt the butter in a pan over a low heat, then set aside to cool slightly. Beat the sugar with the eggs and lemon zest in a bowl until creamy. Pour in the melted butter while continuing to beat, then add the ground almonds (or almond flour) and fold into the mixture. Heat oven to 175C/155C fan/gas 3½."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Line a buttered tart tin or ring mould (approximately 23cm) with the rolled-out pastry dough, then trim any overhanging edges. Spread the frangipane evenly into the tin and arrange the cherries on top with some of their syrup, so the top of the tart is covered in a thin layer."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Put the tart in the oven and bake for about 40-45 mins until golden brown, puffed and firm to the touch. Leave to cool on a rack. Dust with some icing sugar, if you like, before serving in slices."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"250g butter, softened"},{"ingredients":"350g light soft brown sugar"},{"ingredients":"2 large eggs"},{"ingredients":"350g self-raising flour"},{"ingredients":"100g cocoa powder"},{"ingredients":"200g chocolate chips or chopped chocolate chunks, or 400g for optional dipping (choose your favourite type)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Beat the butter and sugar together with an optional pinch of sea salt in a bowl until light and fluffy, then beat in the eggs one at a time. Sift over the flour and cocoa powder and beat into the butter mix, then fold through the chocolate chips. The mix can be made up to 2 days ahead and chilled or frozen for a month, or used straight away."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"To bake, heat oven to 190C/170C fan/gas 5. If the mix is at room temperature, place evenly spaced spoonfuls on parchment-lined baking sheets, allowing 2 tbsp for each cookie. If the mix is fridge cold, you can roll it into 40g balls before baking. The balls can be frozen and the biscuits baked from frozen, but they’ll need a few minutes more. Bake for 12-15 mins until spread out and crusty around the outside. Leave to cool slightly and enjoy warm, or leave to cool completely and eat cold. The biscuits will keep in a tin for three days."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"As an optional extra, the biscuits can be dipped in chocolate. To do this, melt your chosen type of chocolate in a bowl over a pan of simmering water or in the microwave. Leave to cool a little, then dip half of each biscuit in the chocolate and leave them on parchment-lined trays somewhere cool to set. Again, the dipped biscuits will keep for up to three days in a tin or lidded plastic container."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"50g salted butter , softened"},{"ingredients":"125g light brown muscovado sugar"},{"ingredients":"125g golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"1 egg , beaten"},{"ingredients":"200g self-raising flour"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp cocoa powder"},{"ingredients":"200g milk chocolate , broken into chunks"},{"ingredients":"100g white chocolate , melted, for drizzling"},{"ingredients":"100g black sesame seeds (available at Waitrose), plus extra for decorating"},{"ingredients":"100g flavourless oil"},{"ingredients":"30g maple syrup"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"First, make the black tahini. Toast the sesame seeds in a small pan over a gentle heat until you can smell the sesame aroma. Transfer to a mini processor and blitz. Pour in the oil gradually until a paste forms. Add the maple syrup and blitz again. Tip into a small bowl until ready to use."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4 and line two baking sheets with parchment. In a large bowl, beat the butter and sugars together until pale and fluffy. Add the egg and 80g of black tahini paste, and beat to combine. Tip in the flour, cocoa and milk chocolate chunks, and beat until fully incorporated."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Using an ice cream scoop, ball the dough into about 20 pieces and place on the baking sheets. Press each ball lightly so it’s a little flatter, leaving plenty of room between them, as they will spread."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Bake for 6-8 mins until still soft in the middle – they will harden as they cool. Leave to cool on the sheets for a few mins before transferring to wire racks to cool completely."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"Once cooled, drizzle white chocolate zigzags all over the cookies and sprinkle some black sesame seeds on top. Will keep in an airtight container for 3 days."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"140g shelled pistachios"},{"ingredients":"200g milk chocolate , broken into chunks"},{"ingredients":"200g golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"200g very soft butter"},{"ingredients":"3 eggs"},{"ingredients":"200g self-raising flour"},{"ingredients":"100ml milk"},{"ingredients":"150ml soured cream"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Line a 20cm square cake tin with baking parchment. Whizz 125g of the pistachios, 75g of the chocolate and about half the sugar in a food processor until very finely chopped. Tip into a bowl with remaining sugar, butter, eggs, flour and milk, plus a pinch of salt, and beat. Scrape into the tin and bake for 35-45 mins until a skewer poked in comes out clean. Cool."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Melt the remaining milk chocolate, stir in the soured cream and cool until spreadable. Trim the edges off the cake, then split in half. Spread a little icing over the base, sandwich the top of sponge back on. Spread remaining icing over the top, roughly chop the remaining pistachios and scatter them over. Cut into 16 squares to serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"3 medium courgettes , grated"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp salt"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1 small onion , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 garlic  cloves, crushed"},{"ingredients":"100g chestnut mushroom , chopped"},{"ingredients":"350g strong plain flour"},{"ingredients":"7g sachet easy-blend dried yeast"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp chopped fresh basil"},{"ingredients":"½ tbsp  coarse sea salt , to sprinkle"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the grated courgettes in a colander and sprinkle with 1 tsp of the salt. Leave to stand for 20 mins, then, using your hands, squeeze out as much of the moisture as possible. Rinse the courgettes thoroughly, then squeeze again."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat 1 tbsp of the olive oil in a frying pan and cook the onion and garlic for 4 mins until softened.
